data.meta_description: Recently had 'Paneer tikka masala' cooked on the chef robot by Nymble! Was really good and cooked autonomously in 45mins right in front of me! Really proud ofâ€¦
data.text:
Update 4: Introducing Budy - My Next Venture Continuing with the updates I've been sharing, I am beyond thrilled to unveil the name of my next company as promised: Budy! Over the past few months, my exploration into the world of AI, especially Generative AI, has been enlightening. I've especially focused on distinguishing hype from reality, and understanding what's currently achievable versus future aspirations. While my excitementâ€”because of the immense potential of Gen-AI to revolutionize industriesâ€”is high, the challenge of creating genuine value remains as significant as ever. My curiosity was particularly piqued by the complexity enterprises face when deploying software solutions, from ERPs or WMS to Salesforce or HubSpot. Despite the core brilliance in some of these products/platforms, these solutions are always daunting to implement for organizations with pre-existing processes or systems and hence companies rarely realize their full expected outcomes. I wholeheartedly believe that SaaS has revolutionized productivity and brought immense benefits to society. Yet, despite these advancements, the current highly manual state of the $300+ billion software deployment and implementation industry is lagging. It's time for a change, as this outdated approach restricts the full potential of SaaS from being realized. Clearly, we're looking at a massive industry! Those who have collaborated with me on new ventures or ideas are familiar with my approach: Dream big but aim small: i.e., start with focused, achievable goals. The key initial step is to develop and refine a solution that genuinely adds value to a user â€”a value that becomes tangible when customers are willing to pay for it. Enter Budy: An AI co-pilot designed to simplify the Deployment and Management of Sales & Marketing software stacks, such as Salesforce, Marketo, etc. While I have more questions than answers at this stage, the roadmap for the next six months is quite clear: 1. Build & Launch Budy's MVP to 10-15 initial customers focused around one software application. 2. Iterate based on real customer feedback, i.e., further train Budy's capabilities. 3. Release Budy Beta to a wider customer base. 4. Either start scaling to the first $1 million in ARR or go back to the drawing board ğŸ™‚. Lastly, to everyone reading, thank you for your support and involvement in my journey so far, and I am sure it will play a pivotal role in Budy's success as it grows and learns more about how software deployment, or rather the world, works. hereâ€™s how you can help: 1. Product/Industry Feedback: If you're in the SaaS deployment business or have ideas on improving the process, Iâ€™d love to hear from you. 2. Angel Round Participation: If you are interested in participating. 3. Join the Team: I am assembling Budy's founding team. If you're a seasoned full-stack or ML engineer or know someone who is then please connect. #Budy #GenerativeAI #Innovation #Entrepreneurship #Startups #Bitspilani #SaaS

Update 3: Embarking on a New Venture with Sutter Hill Ventures I'm thrilled to announce my next entrepreneurial journey, in partnership with Sutter Hill Ventures (SHV), one of the Bay Area's oldest and most reputable venture capital firms. SHV's unique model of collaborating closely with founders to build market-defining companies, such as Snowflake, Pure Storage, and Laceworks, resonates deeply with me. Personally, I love the people and the builder culture at Sutter Hill Ventures. The plan for the next six months is fairly simple: 1. Discover a Captivating Problem: Find a significant business problem worth solving using Generative AI. 2. Deep Dive through Dialogue: Engage in in-depth conversations with experts both within and outside the domain, enriching my understanding and broadening my perspective. 3. Reflect: Do I still love the space? If not, return to step 1. 4. Launch: Post another update on LinkedIn with the new company name ğŸ™‚. While my search is broad, my initial inclination leans towards solutions for enterprises, leveraging generative AI as a key differentiator. Join me on this exciting new chapter, and wish me the best! If you have insights, advice, or want to contribute to this journey in any way, please feel free to reach out. #NewVenture #Entrepreneurship #SutterHillVentures #Innovation #GenerativeAI #StartupJourney #startups #bitspilani

After spending an amazing 6 months learning, growing and enjoying it, I want to dedicate this post to pause and share the enriching experiences and insights from my journey. I had started my sabbatical around four key themes: Health, Learning, Bucket List, and Giving Back. As I began â€˜executingâ€™ the plan, I learned how intertwined these themes really were. Let me get the exciting bucket list things out of the way: âœ” ğš‚Ì¶ğšÌ¶ğš™Ì¶ğšÌ¶ğš›Ì¶ Ì¶ğš•Ì¶ğš˜Ì¶ğš—Ì¶ğšÌ¶ Ì¶ğšÌ¶ğš›Ì¶ğšŠÌ¶ğš’Ì¶ğš—Ì¶ Ì¶ğš›Ì¶ğš’Ì¶ğšÌ¶ğšÌ¶: Seattle to New York over 3 days with mom ğŸ™‚ âœ” ğ™»Ì¶ğš˜Ì¶ğš—Ì¶ğšÌ¶ Ì¶ğš›Ì¶ğš˜Ì¶ğšŠÌ¶ğšÌ¶ Ì¶ğšÌ¶ğš›Ì¶ğš’Ì¶ğš™Ì¶: Drove from Chicago to San Francisco over 2 weeks & through 6 national parks with the full family ğŸ™‚ âœ˜ Do Doordash for 12+ hrs: Did it for about 4-5 hours, orders were too few, got bored and dropped! âœ” ğ™¼Ì¶ğš˜Ì¶ğšŸÌ¶ğšÌ¶ Ì¶ğšŒÌ¶ğš’Ì¶ğšÌ¶ğš’Ì¶ğšÌ¶ğšœÌ¶ Ì¶ğš Ì¶ğš’Ì¶ğšÌ¶ğš‘Ì¶ğš˜Ì¶ğšÌ¶ğšÌ¶ Ì¶ğšÌ¶ğšœÌ¶ğš’Ì¶ğš—Ì¶ğšÌ¶ Ì¶ğš–Ì¶ğš˜Ì¶ğšŸÌ¶ğšÌ¶ğš›Ì¶ğšœÌ¶: Drove a fully loaded 26 foot long truck over 3400miles/~5500km in 4.5 days! âœ” ğš†Ì¶ğšŠÌ¶ğšÌ¶ğšŒÌ¶ğš‘Ì¶ Ì¶ğŸ¸Ì¶ğŸ¼Ì¶ğŸ½Ì¶ Ì¶ğšÌ¶ğš™Ì¶ğš’Ì¶ğšœÌ¶ğš˜Ì¶ğšÌ¶ğšÌ¶ğšœÌ¶ Ì¶ğš˜Ì¶ğšÌ¶ Ì¶ğ™¼Ì¶ğšŠÌ¶ğš‘Ì¶ğšŠÌ¶ğš‹Ì¶ğš‘Ì¶ğšŠÌ¶ğš›Ì¶ğšŠÌ¶ğšÌ¶: Watched it! Some amazing lessons learned! âœ˜ Complete a vertical marathon ( Climb 86 floors @ Empire State Building ) : Learned that this happens only once a year in Oct through lottery. Did not win the lottery so marked it for next October ğŸ™‚ âœ” ğš†Ì¶ğš˜Ì¶ğš›Ì¶ğš”Ì¶ğš’Ì¶ğš—Ì¶ğšÌ¶ Ì¶ğšŠÌ¶ğšœÌ¶ Ì¶ğšÌ¶ğš›Ì¶ğš˜Ì¶ğš—Ì¶ğšÌ¶â€“Ì¶ğš•Ì¶ğš’Ì¶ğš—Ì¶ğšÌ¶ Ì¶ğšœÌ¶ğšÌ¶ğšŠÌ¶ğšÌ¶ğšÌ¶ Ì¶ğšŠÌ¶ğšÌ¶ Ì¶ğ™¼Ì¶ğšŒÌ¶ğ™³Ì¶: Worked/working as a cashier & barista at Starbucks in Palo Alto since Oct! âœ” ğŸ·Ì¶ğŸ¶Ì¶ Ì¶ğ™³Ì¶ğšŠÌ¶ğš¢Ì¶ Ì¶ğš…Ì¶ğš’Ì¶ğš™Ì¶ğšŠÌ¶ğšœÌ¶ğšœÌ¶ğšŠÌ¶ğš—Ì¶ğšŠÌ¶: Completed in May, Loved it, changed my life! ğ‡ğğšğ¥ğ­ğ¡: I had a moment mid way through where I actually apologized to my body for taking it for granted! Lost a lot of weight! Improved almost all my vital signs, and learned so much about food and how the body works! ğ‹ğğšğ«ğ§ğ¢ğ§ğ : While I learned from & reflected on all my experiences, bucket lists, finance courses on coursera, I think my biggest learning was about our bodies, about what is happiness ? why not having both attachments as well as aversons towards anything is so important! While I understood a little bit about not getting attached to things before, the part about not having aversions towards anything was a big rabbit hole and learning for me. ğ†ğ¢ğ¯ğ¢ğ§ğ  ğğšğœğ¤: While I think I will never really be satisfied by this one, I really appreciate the 100+ purposeless coffee meetings, zoom calls. Frankly I was not expecting this kind of response but I am so grateful for everyone to spare the time and apologize to the ones I missed. Maybe we can now catch up in person or Zoom in on a Saturday :). I am hoping I was able to add some value and help in a little way in your life journey! Last but not the least, I relocated to the ğğšğ² ğ€ğ«ğğš. So please ping in case you are in town or visiting. What next ? In the next post ğŸ™‚ #sabbatical #health #learning #giveback #bucketlist #meditation #happiness #lifejourney

Update: Last week, I stepped aside as the CEO of GreyOrange. After founding and leading GreyOrange for 12 years and running Team AcYut for 4 years before that, I have decided to take a break! A lot of you have asked me what I intend to do next, so I thought I would post it here to both share and take suggestions on how I can improve the list. I envision this sabbatical around 4 themes : Health, Learning, Bucket list, and Giving back Health: Although I started focusing on health a couple of years ago, the main theme is to take time to recharge my physical, mental and spiritual self. Learning: For people that know me, this is a big one and the focus here is to meet and learn from outside supply chain and robotics. I have a couple of Finance courses lined up on coursera; need suggestions on AI. I would love to also help people think through problems/ideas, Product development and GTM so I can learn. I also plan on watching the entire Mahabharata Series ( 290 episodes) since I am tired of being quoted the Mahabharata and now I need to know :). Bucket list: I have 4-5 crazy things to knock off my bucket list - taking a super long train journey, working as front-line staff at McD ( will replace this with Doordash or Lyft ), 10 Day Vipassana etc. Giving Back: In addition to the above personal pursuits, I would like to give back to the community while learning and exploring new things before embarking on my next adventure. Over the last 5-6 years, as GreyOrange became bigger and bigger, life got busier and busier. I significantly decreased my speaking engagements at events and colleges to share our learnings and I want to give time to this. I recently taught a short course on product management and thoroughly enjoyed it, and intend to teach more courses. I will also increase the amount of time I have been spending on advising startups. I get so much energy doing this, so I plan to do more of this before life gets busy again :). Please let me know if you have any other suggestions for ways to give back. I am convinced that GreyOrange would not have gotten this far without the countless people who assisted and taught me along the way, and I intend to contribute further in similar ways. Lastly, I want to spend time with family and friends, as it is something that took a bit of a backseat over the last few years, given the demands of the job. I look forward to doing 'purpose-less coffee' catch ups. Current plan is to be in the following cities over the next couple of months, so do DM or comment if you are in town and would love to meet : SF, Seattle, Boston, Delhi, Bangalore and of course NY (home). #sabbatical #health #learning #giveback #bucketlist #startup #bitspilani
